register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the ADC clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER1 clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the UART0 clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the I2C0 clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the WKUPTIMER_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the WKUPGPIO_DBGICLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the WDT1_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the SMARTREFGLEX SYSCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4_WKUP clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the always on clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register manages the Control Module clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the GPIO0 clocks.

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the L4WKUP clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

register.description: This register manages the TIMER0 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the DEBUGSS clocks.

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: Module standby status.

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the Debugss CLKA clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the L3_AON clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the Debugss sysclk clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3 AON clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register provides automatic control over the DPLL activity.

bitfield.description: This feature is not supported.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated.[warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is not in MN_Bypass
DPLL is in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.
DPLL is LOCKED

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Integer part for DeltaM coefficient
Fractional part for DeltaM coefficient

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Selects CLKINP or CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock

bitenum.description: Selects CLKINP Clock as BYPASS Clock
Selects CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock

bitfield.description: DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 2047). This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. (equal to input M of DPLL; M=2 to 2047 => DPLL multiplies by M).
DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL; actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides automatic control over the DPLL activity.

bitfield.description: AUTO_DPLL_MODE is not supported.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is not in MN_Bypass
DPLL is in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.
DPLL is LOCKED

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Integer part for DeltaM coefficient
Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Select CLKINP orr CLKINPULOW as bypass clock

bitenum.description: Selects CLKINP Clock as BYPASS Clock
Selects CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock

bitfield.description: DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 2047). This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. (equal to input M of DPLL; M=2 to 2047 => DPLL multiplies by M).
DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL; actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL; actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the digitally controlled oscillator output of the PER DPLL.

bitfield.description: Automatic power down for CLKDCOLDO o/p when it is gated

bitenum.description: Keep CLKDCOLDO o/p powered on even when it is gated
Automatically power down CLKDCOLDO o/p when it is gated.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKDCOLDO status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKDCOLDO

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT1 o/p of the HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: Automatic power down for HSDIVIDER M4 divider and hence CLKOUT1 output when the o/p clock is gated.

bitenum.description: Keep M4 divider powered on even when CLKOUT1 is gated.
Automatically power down M4 divider when CLKOUT1 is gated.

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT1_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M4, for internal clock generation. Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT2 o/p of the HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: Automatic power down for HSDIVIDER M5 divider and hence CLKOUT2 output when the o/p clock is gated.

bitenum.description: Keep M5 divider powered on even when CLKOUT2 is gated.
Automatically power down M5 divider when CLKOUT2 is gated.

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT2 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT2

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT2_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M5, for internal clock generation. Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select Triangular Spread Spectrum clocking. Always write 0. 0 = Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected. 1 = Reserved.
Control if only low frequency spread is required

bitenum.description: When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency
When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread only on the lower side of the programmed frequency

bitfield.description: Acknowledgement from the DPLL regarding start and stop of Spread Spectrum Clocking feature

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC disabled
SSC enabled

bitfield.description: Enable the REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL. Please check the DPLL documentation to check when this mode can be enabled.

bitenum.description: REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: Set the DPLL in Low Power mode. Check the DPLL documentation to see when this can be enabled.

bitenum.description: Low power mode of the DPLL is disabled
Low power mode of the DPLL is enabled

bitfield.description: If enabled, the clock ramping feature is used applied during the lock process, as well as the relock process. If disabled, the clock ramping feature is used only during the first lock.

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set.

bitenum.description: DRIFTGUARD feature is disabled
DRIFTGUARD feature is enabled

bitfield.description: Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

bitenum.description: 2 REFCLKs
4 REFCLKs
8 REFCLKs
16 REFCLKs
32 REFCLKs
64 REFCLKs
128 REFCLKs
512 REFCLKs

bitfield.description: The DPLL provides an output clock frequency ramping feature when switching from bypass clock to normal clock during lock and re-lock. The frequency ramping will happen in a maximum of 4 steps in frequency before the DPLL's frequency lock indicator is asserted. This register is used to enable/disable the DPLL ramping feature. If enabled, it is also used to select the algorithm used for clock ramping

bitenum.description: CLKOUT => No ramping CLKOUTX2 => No ramping
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/8 -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/8 -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout/1.5 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2/1.5 -> Foutx2

bitfield.description: DPLL control. Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect MN Bypass mode.

bitenum.description: Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Enables the DPLL in Lock mode

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select Triangular Spread Spectrum clocking. Always write 0. 0 = Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected. 1 = Reserved.
Control if only low frequency spread is required

bitenum.description: When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency
When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread only on the lower side of the programmed frequency

bitfield.description: Acknowledgement from the DPLL regarding start and stop of Spread Spectrum Clocking feature

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC disabled
SSC enabled

bitfield.description: DPLL control. Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect DPLL Low Power Stop mode.

bitenum.description: Put the DPLL in Low Power Stop mode
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Enables the DPLL in Lock mode

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC disabled

bitenum.description: REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: Set the DPLL in Low Power mode. Check the DPLL documentation to see when this can be enabled.

bitenum.description: Low power mode of the DPLL is disabled
Low power mode of the DPLL is enabled

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set.

bitenum.description: DRIFTGUARD feature is disabled
DRIFTGUARD feature is enabled

bitfield.description: Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

bitenum.description: 2 REFCLKs
4 REFCLKs
8 REFCLKs
16 REFCLKs

64 REFCLKs
128 REFCLKs

If enabled, it is also used to select the algorithm used for clock ramping

bitenum.description: CLKOUT => No ramping CLKOUTX2 => No ramping
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/8 -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/8 -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout/1.5 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2/1.5 -> Foutx2

bitfield.description: DPLL control. Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect MN Bypass mode.

bitenum.description: Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Enables the DPLL in Lock mode

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Sigma-Delta divider select (2-255). This factor must be set by s/w to ensure optimum jitter performance. DPLL_SD_DIV = CEILING ([DPLL_MULT/(DPLL_DIV+1)] * CLKINP / 250), where CLKINP is the input clock of the DPLL in MHz). Must be set with M and N factors, and must not be changed once DPLL is locked.

DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 4095). This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. (equal to input M of DPLL; M=2 to 4095 => DPLL multiplies by M).
DPLL divider factor (0 to 255) (equal to input N of DPLL; actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the M2 divider of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKOUT status

bitenum.description: The clock output is gated
The clock output is enabled

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKOUT

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL M2 post-divider factor (1 to 31).

register.description: This register provides controls over the M2 divider of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKOUT status

bitenum.description: The clock output is gated
The clock output is enabled

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKOUT

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL M2 post-divider factor (1 to 31).

The clock output is enabled

bitenum.description: The clock output is gated
The clock output is enabled

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

register.description: This register manages the WKUP M3 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status.

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

register.description: This register manages the UART0 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the I2C0 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4_WKUP clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the always on L4 clock domain.

bitenum.description: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register manages the WDT1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT3 o/p of the HSDIVIDER. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Automatic power down for HSDIVIDER M6 divider and hence CLKOUT3 output when the o/p clock is gated.

bitenum.description: Keep M6 divider powered on even when CLKOUT3 is gated.
Automatically power down M6 divider when CLKOUT3 is gated.

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT3 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT3

bitenum.description: Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it
Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT3_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M6, for internal clock generation. Divide values from 1 to 31.
